meanings.definition: To command or urge solemnly or earnestly
meanings.sent1: She adjured her friend to be careful while crossing the street.
meanings.sent2: The teacher adjured the students to study hard for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat adjured the mouse to stop playing and pay attention.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl adjured the young birds to listen to his advice.
meanings.sent5: The coach adjured the team to give their best performance in the game.

meanings.definition: To charge or bind by oath or strong urging
meanings.sent1: The witness adjured to tell the truth before testifying in court.
meanings.sent2: The knight adjured his squire to be loyal and brave in battle.
meanings.sent3: The magician adjured the audience to keep their eyes closed during the trick.
meanings.sent4: The leader adjured the citizens to defend their homeland at all costs.
meanings.sent5: The doctor adjured the patient to follow the prescribed treatment for a speedy recovery.
